lines.text: Okay, I think I finally get how this one figures into things.
How does a bullet get fired, but suddenly turn around and end up in the one who fired it? <c=#FF0000>Reversing Rune!</c>
What, that magic sticker thing?
Yeah! They took one of those stickers, slapped it on the bullet, and bang! Return to sender!
Explains how the only gun in the room managed to kill the guy holding it, right?
Slick's real cause of death was a gunshot, right, Opal?
...Hmph. Yes. His burns aren't... n-nearly severe enough to kill. Not quickly, anyway.
Riiight. And I'm gonna assume you just figured that out right now, and didn't know that all along and keep it secret.
Because I'm completely- completely innocent of the ch-charges against me. Right.
So! Killed by his own bullet! <c=#FF0000>Reversing Rune!</c> How about that?
Well, there's three problems with that.
Well, lay 'em on me. We can figure it out!
First off- we didn't find any sticker sheet lyin' around. Would he even have access to that?
Well, we didn't find it, but... it'd be a piece of paper.
He could've flushed it down the toilet, left it in the concrete bath, or- more likely, he just burned it.
That'd be another reason to set a fire, right? To hide that evidence!
Hm. Makes sense.
Second, though- <c=#FF00FF>how the heck</c> d'you imagine they put a sticker on a movin' bullet?
...A <c=#FF00FF>moving</c> bullet, huh?
And third- the Go Wizard's clearly got a hole in him! If the bullet killed Slick and not him...
Well, <c=#FF00FF>what happened there?</c>
Hm... so if it wasn't the bullet...
Actually, I think I might have a few ideas about that one.
For real?
Well, alright, then. If you think you can explain that, then let's make it happen.
